   ![Illustration - In-depth - Barca/Israel](/sites/default/files/styles/image_360x240/public/2023-09/ILLUSTRATION_BARCELONA_TELAVIV.jpg?h=5130061d&itok=JwgaTOGe)

Why did Barcelona reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel?
===============================================================

In-depth: In February, Barcelona broke off ties with Israel, citing the systematic violation of Palestinian human rights. Seven months later, and with a new mayor in office, the twin city agreement with Tel Aviv has been restored.

[In-depth](/taxonomy/term/70147 "In-depth")

7 min read

Read Mode

[Bianca Carrera](/taxonomy/term/71601 "Bianca Carrera")

11 September, 2023

[](https://www.addtoany.com/share#url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newarab.com%2Fanalysis%2Fwhy-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel&title=)

On 1 September, the new mayor of the city of Barcelona - Jaume Collboni - signed a decree suspending a [decision by the previous administration](https://www.newarab.com/news/barcelona-cuts-ties-israel-over-palestinian-rights)
 to halt a twinning agreement with Tel Aviv and cut ties with Israel.

The initial decision in February to suspend relations represented a huge milestone for solidarity with Palestine from [city councils](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/how-local-politics-europe-driving-change-palestine)
 around the world.

After progressive Mayor Ada Colau declared it would cease cooperation with Israel and support Palestinians, other cities joined the call, such as the [Belgian city of Liege](https://www.brusselstimes.com/475641/city-of-liege-votes-to-boycott-the-state-of-israel)
 in April and [Brazil’s Belem](https://www.newarab.com/news/brazilian-mayor-declares-city-apartheid-free-zone)
 in May.

Related

[How local politics in Europe is driving change on Palestine](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/how-local-politics-europe-driving-change-palestine "How local politics in Europe is driving change on Palestine")

[Israel](https://www.newarab.com/tag/israel "Israel")

In-depth

Live Story

Jessica Buxbaum

The move came after a campaign by more than a hundred civil society associations which, a few months after being launched, had not just reached but [surpassed](https://twitter.com/proucomplicitat/status/1603728347774816256)
 the number of signatures they needed for the request to be presented to the city council. 

After being approved, a [letter signed by dozens of prominent figures](https://www.lavanguardia.com/local/barcelona/20230214/8755440/cuatro-premios-nobel-medio-centenar-personalidades-internacionales-apoyan-ruptura-barcelona-israel-colau-tel-aviv.html)
, including four Nobel Prize winners and musicians, actors, and intellectuals from around the globe, praised the decision.

But just seven months on and following a contested May election campaign which saw the leader of the centre-left Socialist Party Jaume Collboni obtain a majority in the city council, the tide has turned.

> "The initial decision in February to suspend relations represented a huge milestone for solidarity with Palestine from city councils around the world"

**Legal harassment against institutions and activists**

On the same day that Ada Colau announced the temporary suspension of Barcelona’s twinning agreement with Tel Aviv and its ties to the state, the pro-Israel group ACOM - Action and Communication for the Middle East - [announced](https://a-com.es/acom-anuncia-acciones-legales-contra-ada-colau-y-el-ayuntamiento-de-barcelona-por-su-discriminacion-antisemita/)
 it would take legal measures against the mayoralty’s alleged “hate agenda and its unhealthy obsession against Jews and their state”. 

ACOM, founded in 2004, is the largest of a series of groups that claim their objective is to fight “discrimination against Jews and harassment towards Israel and its citizens”.

Although [self-defined](https://a-com.es/dossier/)
 as a secular and independent entity – reportedly supported by the help of civil society and private donors – the organisation is part of an umbrella of international [pro-Israel groups](https://a-com.es/somos-acom/)
 ranging from MEMRI, the Israeli Allies Foundation, and other influential groups in the United States and beyond.

“ACOM has engaged in intimidating activists and city councils since the Spanish Solidarity Network Against the Occupation of Palestine launched its Apartheid Free Spaces campaign back in 2015,” a Spanish activist and academic who requested anonymity due to a history of reprisals by these groups told _The New Arab_.

![](https://www.newarab.com/sites/default/files/styles/large_16_9/public/452287168.jpeg?h=bc816b12&itok=tzwLcwZo)

Pro-Palestinian demonstrators during a demonstration at Plaza de Catalunya on 17 July 2014 in Barcelona, Spain. \[Getty\]

As ACOM details in its [press releases](https://a-com.es/acom-presenta-recurso-legal-contra-ayuntamiento-de-barcelona/)
, legal actions by the group have resulted in the annulation of 86 institutional agreements in solidarity with Palestine, and in 2016, ACOM’s sister association sought the prosecution of [eight activists](https://law4palestine.org/spain-acquits-8-bds-activists-of-hate-crimes-against-us-jewish-singer-matisyahu/)
 that called for the boycott of Jewish-American reggae artist Matisyahu at the Rototom Sunspalsh Festival, accused by a local BDS group of supporting Israel’s occupation.

In Barcelona, these groups carried out a huge legal campaign against the former mayor and her team, referring complaints to the [administrative courts](https://a-com.es/acom-presenta-recurso-legal-contra-ayuntamiento-de-barcelona/)
 and launching criminal proceedings for alleged hate crimes.

Marc Serra, a councillor in Barcelona’s city council and part of Ada Colau’s party ‘Barcelona En Comú’, told _The New Arab_ that despite the first complaint being filed, these groups have tried to use different legal pathways to achieve their objective.

Related

[From Barcelona to Gaza: Catalonia's Palestine solidarity](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/barcelona-gaza-catalonias-palestine-solidarity "From Barcelona to Gaza: Catalonia's Palestine solidarity")

[Spain](https://www.newarab.com/tag/spain "Spain")

In-depth

Live Story

Bianca Carrera

“There is a pattern in which they file complaints in the courts, in the public prosecutor's office, in the national audience… until they find a judge who ends up agreeing with them or at least opens a way to investigate”.

As a lawyer himself, Serra claims that “we can talk about it as an abuse of the judicial system”. He adds that “what they have achieved is what they were looking for, the opening of criminal proceedings against the Mayor of Barcelona, who took a stand against apartheid towards the Palestinian people, as well as questioning any authority that could take a similar stand”.

> "There is a pattern in which they file complaints in the courts, in the public prosecutor's office, in the national audience… until they find a judge who ends up agreeing with them or at least opens a way to investigate"

**The Socialist Party and renewing ties**

For new Mayor Jaume Collboni and his team, the decision to renew Barcelona’s ties with Israel was not economically driven nor influenced by any interest group, according to officials.

Pau Solanilla, city promotion commissioner under Collboni’s administration and the person who announced the move, told _The New Arab_ that “there has been no pressure or encouragement because it was not necessary, we have been clear that dialogue, cooperation and city diplomacy are useful instruments to contribute to peace in the region”. 

On the same day that Ada Colau broke ties, Jaume Collboni [visited Barcelona’s synagogue](https://www.elperiodico.com/es/barcelona/20230215/maragall-llama-jaume-ii-provocador-83017210)
 to declare that, were he to be elected Mayor, he would reverse Colau’s decision. Yet, only two months later, the facts speak for themselves,” they said.

![](https://www.newarab.com/sites/default/files/styles/large_16_9/public/958998988.jpeg?h=59f9d53c&itok=KyE9Tw8i)

A man with a Palestinian flag pictured during a protest in Barcelona in 2015. “I think it is a very serious thing that these associations are using the discourse on human rights and the fight against discrimination after having ties with the extreme right, which is the one that goes against fundamental rights”.

In his official X account, and on behalf of his party, the city councillor also [reminded the Spanish public](https://twitter.com/MarcSerraSole/status/1697649555452440667)
 of the dangers to fundamental rights within Israel itself.

“Collboni has decided to "embrace" Israel when the state is going through its worst democratic crisis: governed by the far right, with a judicial reform that undermines the separation of powers and an increase in violence against the Palestinian population,” he wrote.

> "The signal being sent to Israel following Barcelona's recent decision is that 'everything is fine, and that there will be no retaliation for the daily and repeated violations against the Palestinians'"

**Impunity for Israel's occupation**

For Pau Solanilla, who speaks for his party’s recent decision to renew ties, the composition of Israel’s far-right government is concerning. They added that, “these crumbs do not provide a political solution to the Palestinian cause".

Israeli forces have killed at least [219 Palestinians](https://www.ochaopt.org/data/casualties)
 since the beginning of 2023 in the occupied West Bank, East Jerusalem, and Gaza Strip, making it the deadliest year since the UN began recording deaths in 2005.

For Laurent Cohen, a Jewish member of the Catalan Association of Jews and Palestinians, the signal being sent to Israel following Barcelona’s recent decision is that “everything is fine, and that there will be no retaliation for the daily and repeated violations against the Palestinians”. 

**Bianca Carrera is a freelance writer and analyst specialising in Middle Eastern and North African politics, as well as environmental matters, at Sciences Po Paris. Some days later, the party also headed a [proposal to re-establish ties](https://ajuntament.barcelona.cat/ca/mandat-2019-2023/accio-de-govern/el-consell-municipal/acords-del-plenari/35184)
 in a council plenary session. He made clear that the move was on his agenda, but associations claim they were not told it would be a priority within his mandate. 

The group that was behind Barcelona’s solidarity campaign with Palestine, ‘Prou Complicitat’, or ‘Enough Complicity’, told _The New Arab_ that Collboni’s Socialist Party later met with the Palestine solidarity movement.

“In this meeting, they acknowledged that their reaction to the suspension was hasty and that they overreacted. \[Getty\]

**Pro-Israel interest groups and the Spanish right**

ACOM was founded in 2004 by businessman David Hatchwell, and is now presided over by the CEO of the international insurance company AmTrust Europe, Angel Mas."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The New Arab published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel. The article mentions that the initial decision to suspend relations with Israel was made in February, and the decision to renew ties was made by the new mayor, Jaume Collboni, in September 2023. The article also mentions that the initial decision was praised by several figures, including Nobel Prize winners. The article also discusses legal actions taken by pro-Israel groups against the former mayor and her team. <image:52>

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel embassy meeting September 2024")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893): 
Content: The Jerusalem Post published an article on February 17, 2023, about FC Barcelona's president Joan Laporta inviting representatives of the Israeli embassy in Spain to a soccer match. The article includes a photo of Israeli diplomats presenting Laporta with an Israeli flag on February 16, 2023. <image:1>.


From [Source](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel): 
Content: The New Arab published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel. The article mentions that the initial decision to suspend relations with Israel was made in February, and the decision to renew ties was made by the new mayor, Jaume Collboni, in September 2023. The article also mentions that the initial decision was praised by several figures, including Nobel Prize winners. The article also discusses legal actions taken by pro-Israel groups against the former mayor and her team. <image:52>


From [Source](https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel): 
Content: The search result from Getty Images contains several photos of FC Barcelona players visiting Israel and the West Bank. The visit took place in August 2013. <image:5624>, <image:5625>, <image:5626>, <image:5627>, <image:5628>, <image:5629>, <image:5631>.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Jerusalem Post ([https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893)) published an article on February 17, 2023, about FC Barcelona's president inviting Israeli embassy representatives to a soccer match, including a photo of the flag exchange on February 16, 2023 (<image:1>). The New Arab ([https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel)) published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel (<image:52>).

Getty Images ([https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel](https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel)) contains photos of FC Barcelona players visiting Israel and the West Bank in August 2013 (<image:5624>, <image:5625>, <image:5626>, <image:5627>, <image:5628>, <image:5629>, <image:5631>).

* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html): 
Content: "A spokesperson for FC Barcelona confirmed the club has not made any such statement.

* * *

A screenshot of a [TikTok video](https://www.tiktok.com/@africancourse_/photo/7417000478984195333)
, claiming that “FC Barcelona has cut all ties with Israel”, has been shared widely on social media.

But Full Fact could find no evidence the football club has ever made such an announcement on its [website](https://www.fcbarcelona.com/en/search?s=Israel)
 or [social](https://x.com/search?q=Israel%20(from%3AFCBarcelona)&src=typed_query)
 [media](https://www.facebook.com/fcbarcelona/?locale=en_GB)
 pages, and there are [no reports](https://www.bbc.co.uk/search?q=%22FC+Barcelona%22+%22Israel%22&d=NEWS_PS)
 from [credible news sources](https://www.reuters.com/site-search/?query=%22FC+Barcelona%22+%22Israel%22&sort=newest&offset=0)
 that it [has done so](https://apnews.com/search?q=%22Barcelona+FC%22+%22Israel%22#nt=navsearch)
.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

Advertisement

A spokesperson for the club also confirmed to Full Fact that “FC Barcelona has NOT made any statement in this regard”.

People may instead be confusing this false claim with a decision made in November 2023 by Barcelona City Council to [suspend institutional ties](https://www.catalannews.com/politics/item/barcelona-suspends-institutional-relations-with-israel-until-definitive-ceasefire)
 with the current Israeli government “until there is a definitive ceasefire”.

The screenshot of the video, posted online on 21 September, has been [reshared](https://www.facebook.com/ebu.seulah/posts/pfbid02BXwwvoqEaS9yKuRYdtJdJNHLshmYP2XYBcjrVAhuQqiPJsxJ8fiNcEPSfjYkeSDNl)

**What was claimed:** FC Barcelona has cut all ties with Israel.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search result from Yahoo News, published by Full Fact, debunks the claim that FC Barcelona has cut ties with Israel. It states that FC Barcelona has not made any such announcement and that the claim may be confused with a decision made in November 2023 by Barcelona City Council to suspend institutional ties with the current Israeli government. <image:13900>

*   [Israel steps up bombardment of Gaza City, kills 16 people around enclave, medics say](/world/israel-steps-bombardment-gaza-city-kills-16-people-around-enclave-medics-say-1223026)
    

A Beitar spokesman said FC Barcelona had asked that the game be played in a city other than Jerusalem, whose eastern sector Israel captured in a 1967 Middle East war and annexed as its capital in a move not recognized internationally.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Reuters**

16 July, 2021, 12:25 pm

Last modified: 16 July, 2021, 12:28 pm

   

Football - La Liga Santander - FC Barcelona v Valencia - Camp Nou, Barcelona, Spain - September 14, 2019 Barcelona's Frenkie de Jong celebrates scoring their second goal with Sergio Busquets and team mates. Reuters

**An Israeli soccer team said on Thursday it has called off a friendly match with Barcelona after the Spanish team declined to play in Jerusalem, a city that Palestinians want part of as their capital.**

Beitar Jerusalem FC, an Israeli Premier League club, had previously reached a tentative deal to host Barcelona on August 4, a person familiar with the planning told Reuters, although neither club had formally announced the match.

Beitar owner Moshe Hogeg said in a statement he had decided not to sign the contract on the match because "I understood that the price I would have to pay is to boycott Jerusalem ... to lend a hand to those who come out against Jerusalem".

####  [![The Business Standard Google News](/sites/all/themes/sloth/images/google_news.svg) Keep updated, follow The Business Standard's Google news channel](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBwgKMIivlQsw2ZKrAw?ceid=US:en&oc=3)

A Beitar spokesman said FC Barcelona had asked that the game be played in a city other than Jerusalem, whose eastern sector Israel captured in a 1967 Middle East war and annexed as its capital in a move not recognized internationally.

An FC Barcelona source told Reuters that the game had never been officially confirmed and that there was now no plan to hold it.

The Barca source declined to respond to Hogeg's remarks.

Palestinians want East Jerusalem as the capital of a state they hope will include the occupied West Bank and the Gaza Strip.

Hogeg said he briefly considered holding the game in Tel Aviv before deciding against it.

"I'm not angry at Barcelona," he said. I don't want to inflame matters, but they weren't willing to sleep in Jerusalem or to visit Jerusalem either."

On Sunday, the Palestinian news agency WAFA quoted FC Barcelona President Joan Laporta as saying the club had not confirmed it would hold any friendly match in Jerusalem.

Barcelona had a history of actions in "clear defence of the rights and freedoms of all peoples of the earth," WAFA quoted Laporta as saying.

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Business Standard published an article on July 16, 2021, discussing a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team, Beitar Jerusalem FC. The match was called off because FC Barcelona declined to play in Jerusalem. The article mentions that Palestinians want East Jerusalem as the capital of a state.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio rescinded the visas of Abbas and 80 other officials ahead of next month's high-level meeting of the U.N. 26, 2024, in New York City. came as the Israeli military [declared Gaza's largest city a combat zone](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/israel-gaza-city-combat-zone-offensive-hostage-bodies-recovered/)

SummarizeSummariesPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved web sources, each one summarized under "Web Sources". **Your task right now is to summarize the web source summaries.**

Always adhere to the following rules:
* Write only one to two paragraphs.
* Include all URLs from the listed sources. Format them as Markdown hyperlinks.
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the summaries.
* Include references (<image:k>) to all relevant images.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel embassy meeting September 2024")
```

## Web Sources
**Web Search Result**

From [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html): 
Content: The search result from Yahoo News, published by Full Fact, debunks the claim that FC Barcelona has cut ties with Israel. It states that FC Barcelona has not made any such announcement and that the claim may be confused with a decision made in November 2023 by Barcelona City Council to suspend institutional ties with the current Israeli government. <image:13900>


From [Source](https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/barcelona-declines-play-jerusalem-friendly-match-cancelled-275614): 
Content: The Business Standard published an article on July 16, 2021, discussing a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team, Beitar Jerusalem FC. The match was called off because FC Barcelona declined to play in Jerusalem. The article mentions that Palestinians want East Jerusalem as the capital of a state.


From [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/palestine-president-mahmoud-abbas-united-nations-visa-revoked/): 
Content: The search result from CBS News discusses the ongoing Gaza war and mentions the U.K. banning Israeli officials from a defense trade show, citing the war. The article also mentions a meeting on post-war Gaza plans and the revocation of visas for Palestinian officials. <image:13926>, <image:13929>. The article was published on September 26, 2024.


## Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The search results include an article from Yahoo News, debunking the claim that FC Barcelona cut ties with Israel, and mentioning a decision by Barcelona City Council to suspend ties with the Israeli government in November 2023. [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html) <image:13900> Another article from The Business Standard discusses a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team. [Source](https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/barcelona-declines-play-jerusalem-friendly-match-cancelled-275614)

CBS News discusses the ongoing Gaza war, mentioning the U.K. banning Israeli officials from a defense trade show and a meeting on post-war Gaza plans. [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/palestine-president-mahmoud-abbas-united-nations-visa-revoked/) <image:13926>, <image:13929>

_________________________



DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel embassy meeting September 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Jerusalem Post ([https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893)) published an article on February 17, 2023, about FC Barcelona's president inviting Israeli embassy representatives to a soccer match, including a photo of the flag exchange on February 16, 2023 (<image:1>). The New Arab ([https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel)) published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel (<image:52>).

Getty Images ([https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel](https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel)) contains photos of FC Barcelona players visiting Israel and the West Bank in August 2013 (<image:5624>, <image:5625>, <image:5626>, <image:5627>, <image:5628>, <image:5629>, <image:5631>).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results include an article from Yahoo News, debunking the claim that FC Barcelona cut ties with Israel, and mentioning a decision by Barcelona City Council to suspend ties with the Israeli government in November 2023. [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html) <image:13900> Another article from The Business Standard discusses a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team. [Source](https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/barcelona-declines-play-jerusalem-friendly-match-cancelled-275614)

CBS News discusses the ongoing Gaza war, mentioning the U.K. banning Israeli officials from a defense trade show and a meeting on post-war Gaza plans. [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/palestine-president-mahmoud-abbas-united-nations-visa-revoked/) <image:13926>, <image:13929>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has had interactions with Israeli representatives and has been involved in events related to Israel. The image in the claim shows a meeting with Israeli representatives. The evidence also mentions the ongoing Gaza war. However, the exact date of the meeting in the image is not specified, and it is not possible to confirm if it took place in September 2024.

Therefore, the claim is unverified due to the lack of information about the date of the meeting.

_________________________



JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel embassy meeting September 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Jerusalem Post ([https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893)) published an article on February 17, 2023, about FC Barcelona's president inviting Israeli embassy representatives to a soccer match, including a photo of the flag exchange on February 16, 2023 (<image:1>). The New Arab ([https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel)) published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel (<image:52>).

Getty Images ([https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel](https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel)) contains photos of FC Barcelona players visiting Israel and the West Bank in August 2013 (<image:5624>, <image:5625>, <image:5626>, <image:5627>, <image:5628>, <image:5629>, <image:5631>).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results include an article from Yahoo News, debunking the claim that FC Barcelona cut ties with Israel, and mentioning a decision by Barcelona City Council to suspend ties with the Israeli government in November 2023. [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html) <image:13900> Another article from The Business Standard discusses a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team. [Source](https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/barcelona-declines-play-jerusalem-friendly-match-cancelled-275614)

CBS News discusses the ongoing Gaza war, mentioning the U.K. banning Israeli officials from a defense trade show and a meeting on post-war Gaza plans. [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/palestine-president-mahmoud-abbas-united-nations-visa-revoked/) <image:13926>, <image:13929>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has had interactions with Israeli representatives and has been involved in events related to Israel. The image in the claim shows a meeting with Israeli representatives. The evidence also mentions the ongoing Gaza war. However, the exact date of the meeting in the image is not specified, and it is not possible to confirm if it took place in September 2024.

Therefore, the claim is unverified due to the lack of information about the date of the meeting.


# Your Judgement



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that FC Barcelona has interacted with Israeli representatives, and the image appears to depict such an interaction. However, the claim specifies the meeting occurred in September 2024 during the Gaza war, which cannot be verified with the available information. The exact date of the meeting is not provided in the search results.

`not enough information`
_________________________



PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
```

### Evidence from `web_search`
The Jerusalem Post ([https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893)) published an article on February 17, 2023, about FC Barcelona's president inviting Israeli embassy representatives to a soccer match, including a photo of the flag exchange on February 16, 2023 (<image:1>). The New Arab ([https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel)) published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel (<image:52>).

Getty Images ([https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel](https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel)) contains photos of FC Barcelona players visiting Israel and the West Bank in August 2013 (<image:5624>, <image:5625>, <image:5626>, <image:5627>, <image:5628>, <image:5629>, <image:5631>).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results include an article from Yahoo News, debunking the claim that FC Barcelona cut ties with Israel, and mentioning a decision by Barcelona City Council to suspend ties with the Israeli government in November 2023. [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html) <image:13900> Another article from The Business Standard discusses a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team. [Source](https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/barcelona-declines-play-jerusalem-friendly-match-cancelled-275614)

CBS News discusses the ongoing Gaza war, mentioning the U.K. banning Israeli officials from a defense trade show and a meeting on post-war Gaza plans. [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/palestine-president-mahmoud-abbas-united-nations-visa-revoked/) <image:13926>, <image:13929>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has had interactions with Israeli representatives and has been involved in events related to Israel. The image in the claim shows a meeting with Israeli representatives. The evidence also mentions the ongoing Gaza war. However, the exact date of the meeting in the image is not specified, and it is not possible to confirm if it took place in September 2024.

Therefore, the claim is unverified due to the lack of information about the date of the meeting.


## Actions
```
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag meeting")
```

# Instructions

* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.

* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `not enough information`: The fact-check does not contain sufficient information to come to an conclusion. For example,there is substantial lack of evidence or the evidence is inconclusive, conflicting or self-contradictory. In the case of a lack of evidence, state which information exactly is missing. In particular, if no RESULTS or sources are available, pick this decision.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Search Result
From [Source](https://kstp.com/ap-top-news/flotilla-leaves-barcelona-in-biggest-attempt-yet-to-break-israeli-blockade-of-gaza/): 
Content: "They will be joined by more ships from ports in Italy and Tunisia in the coming days, on the route from the western end of the Mediterranean to the Gaza Strip, organizers said.

Thousands of supporters flocked to the Barcelona pier, some of them wearing kaffiyehs and chanting “Free Palestine!” and “Boycott Israel!” to send off a wide variety of boats, flying Palestinian flags, from rundown old luxury yachts to tiny wooden sailboats and industrial-looking vessels. Flotilla leaves Barcelona in biggest attempt yet to break Israeli blockade of Gaza
==================================================================================

**By RENATA BRITO and TERESA MEDRANO The Associated Press**  

![](https://kstp.com/wp-content/uploads/apimg/2025/08/Spain_Mideast_Wars_Flotilla_98886.jpg "Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg speaks during a news conference ahead of the launch of a civilian flotilla bound for Gaza, aiming to break the Israeli blockade and deliver humanitarian aid in Barcelona, Spain, Sunday, Aug. (AP Photo/Hernan Munoz)")

##### Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg speaks during a news conference ahead of the launch of a civilian flotilla bound for Gaza, aiming to break the Israeli blockade and deliver humanitarian aid in Barcelona, Spain, Sunday, Aug. (AP Photo/Hernan Munoz)

BARCELONA (AP) — A flotilla of ships departed from Barcelona to the [Gaza Strip](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-offensive-gaza-city-ceasefire-2521a7370ab1cd32cbf28943cc8d542e)
 Sunday with humanitarian aid and activists on board in the largest attempt yet to break the long Israeli blockade of the Palestinian territory by sea.

This comes as [Israel has stepped up its offensive on Gaza City](https://apnews.com/article/israel-palestinians-hamas-war-news-08-30-2025-807071aad1041e8f4d2bf9463361062d)
, limiting the deliveries of food and basic supplies in the north of the Palestinian territory. The almost 23-month war has killed more than 63,000 people, with at least 332 Palestinians dying of malnutrition, including 124 children, according to the Gaza Health Ministry.

The maritime convoy of about 20 boats and delegations from 44 countries is claimed to be the largest attempt to date to break the Israeli blockade of the Gaza Strip by sea, which has now lasted 18 years. One of them, the Sirus, is more than 100 years old.

![Next slide](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

##### Demonstrators shout slogans on a boat ahead of the launch of a civilian flotilla bound for Gaza, aiming to break the Israeli blockade and deliver humanitarian aid in Barcelona, Spain, Sunday, Aug. [She was deported by Israel in June](https://apnews.com/article/thunberg-deported-mideast-gaza-israel-7d6868f213dfcf78969f8e3d982788c6)
 when the ship she was traveling on with 11 other people, the Madleen, was stopped by the Israeli military.

“It has been very clear that Israel has been continuously violating international law by either attacking, unlawfully intercepting the boats in international waters, and continuously preventing the humanitarian aid from coming in,” said Thunberg in an interview with The Associated Press on Saturday.

The Global Sumud Flotilla will be the fourth attempt to break the maritime blockade so far this year. After the Madleen, the [Israeli military stopped another aid ship](https://apnews.com/article/gaza-blockade-activist-ship-seized-24c32eafd80d08a63e5bed8b83d5972f)
, the Handala, in late July, detained 21 international activists and reporters and seized its cargo, including baby formula, food and medicine, according to the Freedom Flotilla Coalition.

In a news conference before the departure in Barcelona, actor Liam Cunningham played a video showing a girl singing while planning her own funeral. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed without permission.

 and that half a million people across the strip were facing catastrophic levels of hunger.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:52> This image shows the President of FC Barcelona with Israel Embassy Representatives in September 2024 during the ongoing Gaza war."

## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag")
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel embassy meeting September 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
The Jerusalem Post ([https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893](https://www.jpost.com/international/article-731893)) published an article on February 17, 2023, about FC Barcelona's president inviting Israeli embassy representatives to a soccer match, including a photo of the flag exchange on February 16, 2023 (<image:1>). The New Arab ([https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/why-barcelona-reversed-its-decision-cut-ties-israel)) published an article on September 11, 2023, discussing Barcelona's decision to reverse its decision to cut ties with Israel (<image:52>).

Getty Images ([https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel](https://www.gettyimages.com/photos/barcelona-visit-the-west-bank-and-israel)) contains photos of FC Barcelona players visiting Israel and the West Bank in August 2013 (<image:5624>, <image:5625>, <image:5626>, <image:5627>, <image:5628>, <image:5629>, <image:5631>).


### Evidence from `web_search`
The search results include an article from Yahoo News, debunking the claim that FC Barcelona cut ties with Israel, and mentioning a decision by Barcelona City Council to suspend ties with the Israeli government in November 2023. [Source](https://uk.news.yahoo.com/fc-barcelona-not-cut-ties-144129508.html) <image:13900> Another article from The Business Standard discusses a cancelled friendly match between FC Barcelona and an Israeli team. [Source](https://www.tbsnews.net/sports/barcelona-declines-play-jerusalem-friendly-match-cancelled-275614)

CBS News discusses the ongoing Gaza war, mentioning the U.K. banning Israeli officials from a defense trade show and a meeting on post-war Gaza plans. [Source](https://www.cbsnews.com/news/palestine-president-mahmoud-abbas-united-nations-visa-revoked/) <image:13926>, <image:13929>


## Elaboration
The evidence confirms that FC Barcelona has had interactions with Israeli representatives and has been involved in events related to Israel. The image in the claim shows a meeting with Israeli representatives. The evidence also mentions the ongoing Gaza war. However, the exact date of the meeting in the image is not specified, and it is not possible to confirm if it took place in September 2024.

Therefore, the claim is unverified due to the lack of information about the date of the meeting.


## Actions
```
image_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag meeting")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `image_search`
FC Barcelona's president, Joan Laporta, met with Isaac Herzog, the President of Israel (<image:13932>). An i24news.tv article shows the same image as the claim, with the President of FC Barcelona and Israeli representatives holding the Israeli flag, and is about FC Barcelona sending a message of support for Israel.


## Elaboration
The image search confirms that the image in the claim shows a meeting between FC Barcelona representatives and Israeli officials. The i24news.tv article indicates that the meeting was about FC Barcelona sending a message of support for Israel. However, the exact date of the meeting is still not specified.

Therefore, the claim remains unverified due to the lack of information about the date of the meeting.


## Actions
```
web_search("FC Barcelona Israel flag meeting date")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `web_search`
From [Source](https://kstp.com/ap-top-news/flotilla-leaves-barcelona-in-biggest-attempt-yet-to-break-israeli-blockade-of-gaza/): 
Content: The Associated Press published an article on August 2025 about a flotilla departing from Barcelona to Gaza to break the Israeli blockade. The article mentions the ongoing war and the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. <image:13933>


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The evidence indicates that the image in the claim depicts a meeting between FC Barcelona representatives and Israeli officials. The search results show that the meeting occurred before August 2025, as the article about the flotilla was published in August 2025. The claim states the meeting occurred in September 2024.

Therefore, the claim is likely true.

JudgePrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
**Determine the Claim's veracity** by following these steps:
1. Briefly summarize the key insights from the fact-check (see Record) in at most one paragraph.
2. Write one paragraph about which one of the Decision Options applies best. Include the most appropriate decision option at the end and enclose it in backticks like `this`.




## Decision Options
* `false`: The claim is not factually accurate. This is the case if one of the following three conditions is met:(1) The claim is demonstrably false when it is disproven by evidence from multiple and reliable sources,(2) The claim or image is taken out of context, i.e. the origin, content and/or meaning of a statement or an image is misrepresented. For example, an old claim or an old image is mispresented in a new context in a misleading way,(3) There is not enough evidence to verify the claim or the evidence is conflicting or self-contradictory.
* `true`: The claim is factually accurate when it is confirmed by evidence from multiple and reliable sources.

SummarizeDocPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You are provided with the record of a fact-check. It contains the Claim to be verified and a documentation of all the fact-checking work along the gathered evidence. Your task is to **summarize the fact-check**. That is, you provide a concise, one-paragraph justification for the final VERDICT based on the knowledge from the Record. Note:
* Be truthful, brief, do not add any additional information besides the information given in the Record. 
* Link key sources in your summary. Use Markdown notation for that. You may link them in-line.
* Don't state the Claim again. Rather focus on the key insights of the fact-check.
* Simply print just the summary.

# Record
## Claim

===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The image in the claim depicts a meeting between FC Barcelona representatives and Israeli officials. The meeting occurred before August 2025, as evidenced by a news article about a flotilla departing from Barcelona in August 2025. Since the claim specifies the meeting occurred in September 2024, the claim is likely true.

PlanPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
The available knowledge is insufficient to assess the Claim. Therefore, **propose a set of actions** to retrieve new and helpful evidence. Adhere to the following rules:
* The actions available are listed under Valid Actions, including a short description for each action. No other actions are possible at this moment. 
* For each action, use the formatting as specified in Valid Actions.
* Include all actions in a single Markdown code block at the end of your answer.
* Propose as few actions as possible, but as much as needed. Do not propose similar or previously used actions.



## Valid Actions
* `reverse_search`
   * Description: Performs a reverse image search to find similar images on the web.
   * How to use: Provide an image and the model will perform a reverse search to find similar images.
   * Format: reverse_search(<image:k>), where `k` is the image's ID

* `image_search`
   * Description: Run an image search on Google to retrieve related images for a given query.
   * How to use: This is a helpful tool for fact-checking images. Use this to retrieve images associated with a specific keyword or phrase. Ensure that the query is clear and specific to improve search accuracy. If no relevant images are found, refine the query or use more descriptive terms.
   * Format: image_search("your image search query goes here")

* `web_search`
   * Description: Run an open web search on Google or DuckDuckGO to retrieve any related webpage.
   * How to use: Do not use this with a previously used or similar query from previous web searches. If a previous web search did not yield any results, use a very different query.
   * Format: web_search("your web search query goes here")

# Example: reverse_search()

## Claim
Text: "<image:k> shows a rare event of a solar eclipse with a double ring."

...

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:k>)
```

# Example: image_search()

## Claim
Text: "Chinese officials in white protective hazmat suits carried people down a hallway to be quarantined for having COVID-19 in November 2022."

...

ACTIONS:
```
image_search("China officials white suits carry people")
image_search("China officials carry people COVID quarantine 2022")
```

# Example: web_search()

## Claim
Text: "New Zealand’s new Food Bill bans gardening"
Claim date: October 29, 2020

...

## Actions
```
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill 2020")
web_search("New Zealand Food Bill gardening ban")
```

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "For the assassination on July 31, 2024, Israeli intelligence tracked Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh through WhatsApp."

## Actions
```
web_search("Ismail Haniyeh assassination July 31 2024")
web_search("Israeli intelligence Hamas leader WhatsApp tracking")
```

# Search Result
From [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh): 
Content: "[Jump to content](#bodyContent)

| [![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/96/Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:Pij_hani_14030509_0357236_(cropped).jpg)<br><br>Haniyeh (left) meeting with the [Supreme Leader of Iran](/wiki/Supreme_Leader_of_Iran "Supreme Leader of Iran")<br> [Ali Khamenei](/wiki/Ali_Khamenei "Ali Khamenei")<br> (right) hours before his death |     |

| Location | [Tehran](/wiki/Tehran "Tehran")<br>, [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran") |
| [Coordinates](/wiki/Geographic_coordinate_system "Geographic coordinate system") | [35°49′10″N 51°24′57″E﻿ / ﻿35.81944°N 51.41583°E﻿ / 35.81944; 51.41583](https://geohack.toolforge.org/geohack.php?pagename=Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh&params=35_49_10_N_51_24_57_E_) |

| Target | [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")<br> [**X**](/wiki/Assassination "Assassination") |
| Attack type | [Explosion](/wiki/Explosion "Explosion")<br> or [projectile attack](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile")<br> (disputed)[\[a\]](#cite_note-4) |
| Deaths | Ismail Haniyeh  <br>Wassim Abu Shaaban |
| Perpetrator | ![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/40px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png)[Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel") |

On 31 July 2024, [Ismail Haniyeh](/wiki/Ismail_Haniyeh "Ismail Haniyeh")
, the political leader of [Hamas](/wiki/Hamas "Hamas")
, was assassinated along with his personal bodyguard in the Iranian capital [Tehran](/wiki/Tehran "Tehran")
 by an [Israeli](/wiki/Israel "Israel")
 attack.[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
[\[5\]](#cite_note-:8-6)
 Haniyeh was killed in his accommodation in a military-run guesthouse after attending the inauguration ceremony for Iranian president [Masoud Pezeshkian](/wiki/Masoud_Pezeshkian "Masoud Pezeshkian")
.[\[6\]](#cite_note-reuters31july-7)
 [Nasser Kanaani](/wiki/Nasser_Kanaani "Nasser Kanaani")
, the spokesman of the [Ministry of Foreign Affairs](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)")
 of [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran")
, condemned this assassination and said that Haniyeh's "blood will never be wasted".[\[7\]](#cite_note-aje.io-8)

The cause of Haniyeh's death is under investigation by Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC).[\[8\]](#cite_note-9)
 Differing reports emerged as to how he was killed, ranging from a missile strike[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
 to a remotely detonated explosive device previously hidden in his bedroom at the IRGC-run guesthouse.[\[2\]](#cite_note-:4-2)
 According to analysts, the assassination exposed critical security flaws.[\[9\]](#cite_note-nyt3aug-10)
[\[10\]](#cite_note-:9-11)
 The investigation has led to the arrest of over two dozen individuals, including senior intelligence and military officials, as well as staff from the guesthouse.[\[9\]](#cite_note-nyt3aug-10)

Haniyeh was a prominent figure within Hamas since the organization's founding in 1987. Haniyeh was the highest-ranking Hamas political leader killed since the start of the [Gaza war](/wiki/Gaza_war "Gaza war")
.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)

Background
----------

### Ismail Haniyeh

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4e/03-03-2020_Ismail_Haniyeh_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-03-03-2020_Ismail_Haniyeh_%28cropped%29.jpg)](/wiki/File:03-03-2020_Ismail_Haniyeh_(cropped).jpg)

, and a group of men posing with a model of the [Dome of the Rock](/wiki/Dome_of_the_Rock "Dome of the Rock")
.[\[17\]](#cite_note-nyt30jul-18)

### Killings of Hamas officials

In response to the [October 7 attack](/wiki/October_7_attack "October 7 attack")
, Israel stated it would target Hamas leaders.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)
 On 2 January 2024, Hamas deputy [Saleh al-Arouri](/wiki/Saleh_al-Arouri "Saleh al-Arouri")
 was [assassinated](/wiki/Assassination_of_Saleh_al-Arouri "Assassination of Saleh al-Arouri")
 in an airstrike in [Beirut](/wiki/Beirut "Beirut")
.[\[18\]](#cite_note-j076-19)
 On 13 July 2024, Israel attempted to assassinate Hamas military chief [Mohammed Deif](/wiki/Mohammed_Deif "Mohammed Deif")
, with the [Israel Defense Forces](/wiki/Israel_Defense_Forces "Israel Defense Forces")
 announcing his death on 1 August.[\[19\]](#cite_note-20)
 Hours before Haniyeh's death, Israel announced the [assassination of Fuad Shukr](/wiki/Killing_of_Fuad_Shukr "Killing of Fuad Shukr")
, a senior [Hezbollah](/wiki/Hezbollah "Hezbollah")
 leader in Beirut.[\[11\]](#cite_note-wsj31july-12)

Assassination
-------------

The initial report of Ismail Haniyeh's killing emerged from Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps](/wiki/Islamic_Revolutionary_Guard_Corps "Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps")
 (IRGC), who provided limited specifics regarding the circumstances of his death, which it said occurred early on 31 July and indicated that the incident was under investigation. Ismail Haniyeh")
**

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/20px-Commons-logo.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Commons-logo.svg)
 Media related to [Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh](https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Assassination_of_Ismail_Haniyeh "commons:Category:Assassination of Ismail Haniyeh")
 at Wikimedia Commons

Courts

|     |     |
| --- | --- |
| Global courts | *   [_South Africa v. He also called for the Palestinian people to unite.[\[20\]](#cite_note-arabiya-21)
[\[85\]](#cite_note-89)
 Palestine's deputy permanent observer to the United Nations, Feda Abdelhady Nasser, called on the international community to stop Israel from dragging the Middle East into the "abyss".[\[86\]](#cite_note-unsc-90)
 Former [PLO](/wiki/Palestine_Liberation_Organization "Palestine Liberation Organization")
 member [Hanan Ashrawi](/wiki/Hanan_Ashrawi "Hanan Ashrawi")
 said that Israel's "gangster style" assassination of Haniyeh was made to "inflame the whole region".[\[87\]](#cite_note-91)

Hamas said that it mourned the death of Haniyeh, who it said was killed in "a treacherous Zionist raid on his residence".[\[88\]](#cite_note-x734-92)
 Senior Hamas official [Mousa Abu Marzook](/wiki/Mousa_Abu_Marzook "Mousa Abu Marzook")
 said that Haniyeh's assassination was "a cowardly act that will not pass in vain".[\[89\]](#cite_note-c729-93)
 Another senior official, [Sami Abu Zuhri](/wiki/Sami_Abu_Zuhri "Sami Abu Zuhri")
, accused Israel of killing Haniyeh, stating that it aims to break the will of Hamas and the Palestinians.[\[90\]](#cite_note-aljazeera.com-94)
 Hamas's military wing, the Al-Qassam Brigades, called the assassination a "dangerous event" that will have "major repercussions across the entire region".[\[91\]](#cite_note-95)

Palestinian Islamic Jihad released a statement saying that it "mourns with the Palestinian people and the Arab and [Islamic nation](/wiki/Ummah "Ummah")
" for the death of Haniyeh.[\[92\]](#cite_note-:0-96)

On 2 August, former [Grand Mufti of Jerusalem](/wiki/Grand_Mufti_of_Jerusalem "Grand Mufti of Jerusalem")
 Sheikh [Ekrima Sa'id Sabri](/wiki/Ekrima_Sa%27id_Sabri "Ekrima Sa'id Sabri")
 was arrested by Israeli police on suspicion of inciting "terrorism" after calling Haniyeh a "martyr" during a sermon in [East Jerusalem](/wiki/East_Jerusalem "East Jerusalem")
.[\[93\]](#cite_note-97)

### Iran

Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei held an emergency Supreme National Security Council meeting with top Iranian officials following the assassination.[\[17\]](#cite_note-nyt30jul-18)
 Khamenei later stated that "With this action, the criminal and [terrorist](/wiki/Israel_and_state-sponsored_terrorism "Israel and state-sponsored terrorism")
 [Zionist regime](/wiki/Zionist_regime "Zionist regime")
 prepared the ground for harsh punishment for itself, and we consider it our duty to seek revenge for his blood as he was [martyred](/wiki/Shahid "Shahid")
 in the territory of the Islamic Republic of Iran".[\[94\]](#cite_note-c453-98)
 _The New York Times_, citing Iranian officials, reported that he ordered direct strikes against Israel in response to the assassination.[\[43\]](#cite_note-nyt31jul-44)
[\[95\]](#cite_note-99)
 [Foreign Ministry](/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_Affairs_(Iran) "Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)")
 spokesman [Nasser Kanaani](/wiki/Nasser_Kanaani "Nasser Kanaani")
 condemned the assassination, stating that Haniyeh's "blood will never be wasted".[\[7\]](#cite_note-aje.io-8)
 President Masoud Pezeshkian condemned the assassination and said Iran will defend its territorial integrity and make those responsible regret their actions.[\[4\]](#cite_note-AP31july-5)
 The government announced three days of public mourning for Haniyeh.[\[96\]](#cite_note-100)
 At the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations "United Nations")
, Iran's ambassador [Amir Saeid Iravani](/wiki/Amir_Saeid_Iravani "Amir Saeid Iravani")
, called on the [UN Security Council](/wiki/United_Nations_Security_Council "United Nations Security Council")
 to condemn Israel and said that Iran had a right to respond in self-defence to the killing, which he described as part of "Israel's decades-long pattern of terrorism and sabotage targeting Palestinians and other supporters of the Palestinian cause across the region and beyond." He also accused the United States of responsibility over the assassination.[\[86\]](#cite_note-unsc-90)
 The chief of staff of the [Iranian armed forces](/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran_Armed_Forces "Islamic Republic of Iran Armed Forces")
, [Mohammad Bagheri](/wiki/Mohammad_Bagheri_(general) "Mohammad Bagheri (general)")
, suggested that the response could come as part of a coordinated effort with the [Axis of Resistance](/wiki/Axis_of_Resistance "Axis of Resistance")
.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:7-3)

The [Tehran Stock Exchange](/wiki/Tehran_Stock_Exchange "Tehran Stock Exchange")
 fell 1.9%.[\[97\]](#cite_note-101)
 Iran's chief prosecutor warned journalists against "spreading rumours".[\[98\]](#cite_note-102)

A red flag was hoisted above the [Jamkaran Mosque](/wiki/Jamkaran_Mosque "Jamkaran Mosque")
 in [Qom](/wiki/Qom "Qom")
 and the [Milad Tower](/wiki/Milad_Tower "Milad Tower")
 in Tehran was lit up in red overnight.[\[3\]](#cite_note-:7-3)
 A large banner was placed in Tehran's Palestine Square, featuring a portrait of Haniyeh alongside the Dome of the Rock, with a message in [Farsi](/wiki/Persian_language "Persian language")
 and [Hebrew](/wiki/Hebrew_language "Hebrew language")
 reading: 'Wait for severe punishment.'"[\[99\]](#cite_note-103)

Opposition figures [Masih Alinejad](/wiki/Masih_Alinejad "Masih Alinejad")
, [Hamed Esmaeilion](/wiki/Hamed_Esmaeilion "Hamed Esmaeilion")
 and [Reza Pahlavi](/wiki/Reza_Pahlavi,_Crown_Prince_of_Iran "Reza Pahlavi, Crown Prince of Iran")
 called the killing of Haniyeh the sign of iniquity of the Iranian regime.[\[100\]](#cite_note-104)
[\[101\]](#cite_note-105)
[\[102\]](#cite_note-106)

### Israel

The Israel Defense Forces told [CNN](/wiki/CNN "CNN")
 they "don't respond to reports in the foreign media".[\[103\]](#cite_note-107)
 The IDF did not release new security guidelines for civilians.[\[6\]](#cite_note-reuters31july-7)
 Heritage Minister [Amihai Eliyahu](/wiki/Amihai_Eliyahu "Amihai Eliyahu")
 praised the assassination, saying that it "makes the world a little better",[\[104\]](#cite_note-108)
[\[90\]](#cite_note-aljazeera.com-94)
 and that killing him was "the right way to cleanse the world from this filth."[\[105\]](#cite_note-109)
[\[106\]](#cite_note-110)
 Israel increased security measures at its diplomatic missions and Jewish sites worldwide.[\[107\]](#cite_note-111)
 The security of [Israel's delegation](/wiki/Israel_at_the_2024_Summer_Olympics "Israel at the 2024 Summer Olympics")
 in the [2024 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics "2024 Summer Olympics")
 was increased due to fears of potential attacks.[\[108\]](#cite_note-112)
 Then-Defense Minister [Yoav Gallant](/wiki/Yoav_Gallant "Yoav Gallant")
 addressed troops at an [Arrow](/wiki/Arrow_(missile_family) "Arrow (missile family)")
 missile air-defense battery, stating, "We don't want war, but we are preparing for all possibilities."[\[109\]](#cite_note-113)
 In December 2024, Defense Minister [Israel Katz](/wiki/Israel_Katz "Israel Katz")
 confirmed Israel's responsibility in the assassination of Haniyeh while delivering a threat to the Yemeni [Houthi movement](/wiki/Houthi_movement "Houthi movement")
, stating, "We will strike \[the Houthis'\] strategic infrastructure and decapitate its leaders. Just as we did to Haniyeh, [Sinwar](/wiki/Killing_of_Yahya_Sinwar "Killing of Yahya Sinwar")
, and [Nasrallah](/wiki/2024_Hezbollah_headquarters_strike "2024 Hezbollah headquarters strike")
, in Tehran, Gaza, and Lebanon—we will do in [Hodeidah](/wiki/Al_Hudaydah "Al Hudaydah")
 and [Sanaa](/wiki/Sanaa "Sanaa")
."[\[5\]](#cite_note-:8-6)
[\[110\]](#cite_note-114)

### International

The United Nations Security Council held an emergency session on 31 July following the assassination, during which China, Russia and Algeria condemned the killing. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731123456/https://www.cnn.com/2024/07/31/middleeast/analysis-iran-options-ismail-haniyeh-killing-intl/index.html)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731041436/https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/hamas-political-leader-ismail-haniyeh-killed-in-iran-5723ad8b?mod=hp_lead_pos1)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731034454/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/31/hamass-political-chief-ismail-haniyeh-assassinated-in-iran-state-media)
     from the original on 31 July 2024. [Archived](https://web.archive.org/web/20240731040020/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/world-news/2024/07/31/israel-hamas-war-latest-news-leader-ismail-haniyeh-killed/)
     from the original on 31 July 2024."

# Your Summary



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The Wikipedia article discusses the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh on July 31, 2024, in Tehran, Iran. The attack was carried out by Israel. The article does not mention any information about WhatsApp tracking.

_________________________



SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "For the assassination on July 31, 2024, Israeli intelligence tracked Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh through WhatsApp."

## Actions
```
web_search("Ismail Haniyeh assassination July 31 2024")
web_search("Israeli intelligence Hamas leader WhatsApp tracking")
```
